question: when did the anti smacking law come in nz
api_result: The anti-smacking law in New Zealand, officially known as the amendment to Section 59 of the Crimes Act 1961, was passed in 2007. This amendment, often referred to as the "anti-smacking law," removed the legal defense of "reasonable force" for parents prosecuted for assault on their children. It was aimed at preventing physical punishment in disciplining children. The law came into effect following considerable public debate and was passed in Parliament on May 16, 2007.
